poem:
The Meaning of Words  

The term, she says,  
stretched thin  
like a threadbare quilt—  
one in four  
claim its warmth.  

Yet consider—  
the invisible weight  
of soft whispers,  
silent throbs,  
and unseen clouds.  

Not all wounds  
wear a name,  
but all seek  
the sun's gentle light  
to grow.
